level.text: The primary certifying officer for each agency shall serve as the agency’s designated payment officer.
The designated payment officer shall be responsible for the following duties:
Designate the central receiving point for all invoices from business concerns;
Establish a system for recording the receipt of all invoices;
Determine whether invoices meet the criteria for proper invoices under § 1704;
Notify a business concern in writing, as provided in § 1705, of any defects or impropriety in invoices which would prevent payment of the invoice;
Determine the required payment date for all invoices that meet the requirements for payments; and
Calculate the penalties due on payments which are not made by the required payment date.
